Think Jewish physicists in the 1930s, German engineers after the 1940s, or Chinese scientists after their Civil War and the Cultural Revolution. It's a big reason we have had by far the best institutes of higher education despite being completely mediocre at K-12 education.  All of a sudden, all three of these are in peril.  Imagine if you were a basketball player, and all you wanted to do was play basketball at the highest level. Over essentially this same time (the precursor to the NBA was founded in 1946), the best place to do this would have been in the United States, regardless of your country of origin.  Now imagine that abruptly the NBA were disbanded due to executive order. And consider the following:  - Obviously, scientists are compensated much less than NBA players, meaning they do not have the "luxury" of waiting out for a more stable environment. - Whereas NBA players can go professional straight out of high school or after a few years of college, scientists need an additional 15-20 years after college to be able to secure their first funding sources. This is for the minuscule proportion competitive enough to apply for this diminish share of the pie. - There is sometimes healthy debate within the normal scientific and communities around emerging topics, and then there are wholescale attacks on topics for which there is consensus, like COVID, vaccines, climate change. - The most celebrated scientists and physicians such as Anthony Fauci have been subject to maligned and subjected to stochastic terrorism, and his eventual successor Jeanne Marrazzo was put on leave and threatened with relegation to a rural site. If the United States had a Siberia, I'm sure they would have loved to send her there. Instead, they've been replaced by stooges with absolutely no qualification for their positions.  For an immigrant from another country, or even for a native US scientist whose known no other country, how do you justify staying? We're this close to being tried for heresy like Galileo or falling into 21st century Lysenkoism.
